info.name: BuildingConnected API Production-Final
info.description:
BuildingConnected API covering both BuildingConnected Pro and Bid Board Pro.

Contact Support:
 Email: acs.winning.bidding.engineers@autodesk.com

exec: pm.test("List All Projects Members, Status code is 200", function () {

query.description:
An opaque cursor token that identifies where the next page of paginated results should start. It's returned in
each paginated response so that it can be supplied in the next request to continue paginated results. If a
paginated response contains no ``cursorState`` value, then there are no further pages to return.

Omit this field to initiate a paginated request or to restart pagination.
Determines the maximum number of objects that MAY be returned. A query MAY return fewer than the value of limit due to filtering or other reasons.
Filter to objects matching this bidder company ID.

A string that specifies a date and time or a date and time range at which all returned objects mast have been
updated. A single date and time takes this format: ``YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ``, A date and time range takes this
format: ``YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ..YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ``. Range queries can be closed or open in either
direction: ``YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ..`` or ``..YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ``.

query.description:
An opaque cursor token that identifies where the next page of paginated results should start. It's returned in
each paginated response so that it can be supplied in the next request to continue paginated results. If a
paginated response contains no ``cursorState`` value, then there are no further pages to return.

Omit this field to initiate a paginated request or to restart pagination.
Determines the maximum number of objects that MAY be returned. A query MAY return fewer than the value of limit due to filtering or other reasons.

A string that specifies a date and time or a date and time range at which all returned objects mast have been
updated. A single date and time takes this format: ``YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ``, A date and time range takes this
format: ``YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ..YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ``. Range queries can be closed or open in either
direction: ``YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ..`` or ``..YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ``.
Filter to projects matching this ACC linked project ID.
Search for projects whose name or number matches this text. It is case-insensitive and only matches from the start of a word.
Whether to include closed projects in the response. If ``true``, closed projects are included. If ``false``, they are not. The default is ``false``.

exec: pm.test("Create project, Status code is 201", function () {

body.raw:
{ "name": "Office Renovation", "number": "12345", "client": "Wells Fargo", "value": 1000000, "notes": "
This project's important notes.
", "projectSize": 32000, "projectSizeUnits": "SQUARE_FEET", "isBiddingSealed": false, "owningOfficeId": "{{officeId}}", "isPublic": true, "bidsDueAt": "2024-09-22T16:27:37.437Z", "endsAt": "2024-09-22T16:27:37.437Z", "rfisDueAt": "2024-09-22T16:27:37.437Z", "startsAt": "2024-09-22T16:27:37.437Z", "jobWalkAt": "2024-09-22T16:27:37.437Z", "dueAt": "2024-09-22T16:27:37.437Z", "location": { "country": "US", "state": "CA", "streetName": "California St.", "streetNumber": "600", "suite": "6th Floor", "city": "San Francisco", "zip": "94108" }, "accountManager": "Name of account manager", "feePercentage": 15.55, "marketSector": "Sports Stadium Construction", "defaultCurrency": "USD", "architect": "Browning Day Mullins Dierdorf Architects", "isForBudgeting": false, "isCompetitive": false }

exec: pm.test("Batch Create Bid Packages, Status code is 201", function () {

body.raw:
[
        {
          "projectId": "{{projectId}}",
          "name": "Concrete - package 1",
          "number": "03",
          "keywords": [
            "Concrete"
          ],
          "leadUserId": "{{userId}}",
          "estimatedCost": 100000,
          "instructions": "Instruction about bid",
          "bidsDueAt": "2024-09-25T19:00:00.000Z", 
    
          "template": {
            "bidPackageId": "{{bidPackagetId}}",
            "includeForm": true,
            "includeFiles": false,
            "bidderStates": [
              "UNDECIDED",
              "NOT_BIDDING",
              "BIDDING",
              "BID_SUBMITTED",
              "NOT_INVITED"
            ]
          }
        },

         {
          "projectId": "{{projectId}}",
          "name": "Concrete pachage 2",
          "number": "03",
          "keywords": [
            "Concrete"
          ],
          "leadUserId": "{{userId}}",
          "estimatedCost": 100000,
          "instructions": "Instruction about bid",
          "bidsDueAt": "2024-09-25T19:00:00.000Z",
        
          "template": {
            "bidPackageId": "{{bidPackagetId}}",
            "includeForm": true,
            "includeFiles": false,
            "bidderStates": [
              "UNDECIDED",
              "NOT_BIDDING",
              "BIDDING",
              "BID_SUBMITTED",
              "NOT_INVITED"
            ]
          }
        }

      ]

each paginated response so that it can be supplied in the next request to continue paginated results. If a
paginated response contains no ``cursorState`` value, then there are no further pages to return.

Determines the maximum number of objects that MAY be returned. A query MAY return fewer than the value of limit due to filtering or other reasons.
Filter to objects matching this bid package ID.
Filter to objects matching this invite ID.

A string that specifies a date and time or a date and time range at which all returned objects mast have been
updated. A single date and time takes this format: ``YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ``, A date and time range takes this

Whether to only include bids that are the latest revision for an invited company. If ``true``, only the latest revisions are included. If ``false``, all revisions are included. The default is ``false``.

url.raw: An opportunity can easily be opened in Bid Board using its opportunity ID. If you want to expose an easy way to navigate to an opportunity in your CRM or ERP system (or open the page in an iframe), use the following URL format: https://app.buildingconnected.com/opportunities/{opportunityId}/info where {opportunityId} is equivalent to the id field in opportunity objects that are retrieved using GET opportunities.

direction: ``YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ..`` or ``..YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ``.
Filter to projects matching this ACC linked project ID.
Search for projects whose name or number matches this text. It is case-insensitive and only matches from the start of a word.

url.raw: Each project has a subset of bid packages; each bid package has a subset of invites; each invite has a subset of bids. Bids have all relevant ids: projectId, bidPackageId, and inviteId; invites have a bidPackageId and projectId field; and bid packages have a projectId field. Use these unique IDs to accurately map objects correctly according to the following wireframe.
